Technique: FORMED BY HAND; PAINTED; ENGRAVED; FAYENCE; ENGRAVED
Name: Shabti of Ouahibre-em-akhet
Description: This shabti of beige faience, dating from the 26th Dynasty, bears the name of Ouahibre-em-akhet. The text, taken from Chapter 6 of the Book of the Dead, is written on eight horizontal lines. The Museum of Brussels preserves another shabti of the same person in its egyptian collection (E.5541)
